Some people say we didn't really go to moon and it's was a outrageously expensive film. What do you think?

post_info.post_title: Did we really go to moon?

I think we (well, not we) really went to the moon.
I am undecided. There's a lot of evidence that we didn't... there was a special on a network a few years ago that presented the argument, but I can't remember much of it.
FOX had a show about it a while ago. NASA said that the producers never bothered to contact them so they could answer their questions. They then refuted all the FOX statements.
Did they put that up somewhere on the web?

there are lots of evidence that we didn't land on the moon.
 
 footprints: you need moisture to make footprints...
 
 crosshairs: in one picture, the crosshait actually goes over and behind the same object; evidence of photoshoping.
 
 stars: there are NO stars in the photos. the sky should be FULL of them.
 
 shadows: in a lot of the pictures, the shadows do not match.
 
 huge packs: the large packs the astronauts carry are measured to be larger than the door of the ship. they couldn't have gotten out!
 
 radiation: there is a deep radiation field in our atmosphere. i believe 20 miles (20 something lol). many scientists have written books about how it is impossible to get live things through this field (i don't know much of this though).
 
 i believe it was hoaxed. the usa wanted to be first in the space race. we will lower ourselves to anything to be on top.

That's one thing they showed in that special... they also put some of the pictures supposedly taken in different areas on top of each other and the scenes matched. 
 
 Something about over half of the astronaut corps being replaced and many senior managers killed in freak accidents. 
 
 That's all I can think of at the moment...

There are a lot of web sites dedicated to this issue. I don't know where it started, possibly with flat earthers. Pictures of a spherical earth are necessarily fakes if the earth is flat. It's the same sort of mentality, though. It's all a big conspiracy, of course. And the government isn't above the murder of lots of people, including burning three astronauts alive, to keep the secret. Yep. That's sane. This sort of claptrap is on a level with a 6000 year old earth, except that not even the creationists buy into this one.
 
 Here is one site that deals with the illiterate science that the Fox television show "revealed". Who Mours for Apollo? or Was It Really Only A Paper Moon?
 
 Now I don't really expect the conspiracy junkies to read this or to actually check out the science of it all, but there may be some interested readers who want to know.
 
 Oh, yeah. One of my brothers former neighbors was an Apollo astronaut. My brother used to throw a big Christmas party for his family, friends, neighbors and employees. This astronaut was either the best liar/actor ever, or he really did go to the moon. Of course, the government would have killed him if he had told the truth, right?
 
 Isn't it sad that there isn't enough real XXXX going on to satisfy some people?
More rebuttles to FOX at BadAstronomy.com

Of course we have been to the moon. I'm pretty sure the first landing was also a real landing but even if it wasn't then we landed their later. It would be quite a coverup for no apparent reason to make us all think that the moon was landed on when it really wasn't. Also, why is NASA still around if they cannot even land us on the moon? What purpose would they serve if they couldn't achieve landing on another planet?

I've talked to ham operators who tracked some of the missions to the moon with their own equipment, including measuring the doppler shift change as the lander came to a stop on the moon.
 
 http://www.users.wineasy.se/svengrahn/trackind/Apollo17/APOLLO17.htm
 
 Some of the results were published in QST in 1972.

One of my brothers former neighbors was an Apollo astronaut.

oh, i believe we landed on the moon; just not at the time we said we did. i see that we only wanted to win the space race.
Why is this in the science forum? Let's try to keep this a place for the scientifically literate.

there are lots of evidence that we didn't land on the moon.
 
 footprints: you need moisture to make footprints...

 huge packs: the large packs the astronauts carry are measured to be larger than the door of the ship. they couldn't have gotten out!
 
 radiation: there is a deep radiation field in our atmosphere. i believe 20 miles (20 something lol). many scientists have written books about how it is impossible to get live things through this field (i don't know much of this though).
 
 i believe it was hoaxed. the usa wanted to be first in the space race. we will lower ourselves to anything to be on top.

 
 This is typically bad science:
 
 1) The moon is covered with a thin layer of dust. Trying stepping in something similar sometimes (sawdust, for example) and tell me you "need moisture".
 
 2) Why dont you see stars? Simple: to take good photos on the moon, you need high exposure time and a closed aperture setting. This makes faint stars (relative to the images on the moon itself) are difficult to see. You can test this out yourself here on earth.
 
 3) The sun is not the only source of light on the moon. Actually, the moon itself is one, and reflects light in a rather pecular way.
 
 4) This one is new to me, but I can assure you its equally absurd.
 
 5) The van Allen belts (which are, by the way, outside of our atmosphere) were passed through too quickly to harm astronauts. You can see the actual radiation doses here.
 
 -GFA

I have an odd, but compromise theory...
 
 I believe Armstrong et al got to the moon, but they weren't sure about the quality of the pictures, so before-hand they staged them, and then broadcast these.
 
 In other words, the landings were real, but some of the pictures were fake!
 
 emoticon_zzzz

Hi,
 after reading this thread...it started out okay at first, but I can't stand it when people propose fresh alternatives (if they could be called fresh alternatives) to present theories.
 
 First of all, this is not an opinion. There is no "undecided": either we did or we didn't. You can undecided as whether or not we did or did not land on the moon, but we can't have "sort of" landed on the moon.
 
 
Originally Posted by God Fearing Ath
 Do you think that, had we faked it, the commies wouldnt have uttered a peep about it?
 
 -GFA

 That's right...if there was any possibility we didn't do it the Soviets would have jumped right on top of us and shouted, "Wait a minute! it was a hoax!"
 
 
I have an odd, but compromise theory...
 
 I believe Armstrong et al got to the moon, but they weren't sure about the quality of the pictures, so before-hand they staged them, and then broadcast these.
 
 In other words, the landings were real, but some of the pictures were fake!

 
 Sure...exactly...I'm sure that answers just all of our questions. 'Weren't sure about the quality of the pictures...' and so all that training and research was for nothing then? Ten years, you come out with some of the most awe-inspiring technology the world has yet seen, and then you realize you're not sure if your cameras can take high quality pictures on the moon, so you faked it. Riiiiight...
 Sort of like this argument: someone once said on a forum that he/she thought that we DID go to the moon, but we just forgot our camera. Yep...I'm sure that happened. "Houston, we have a problem. We, uh, forgot the camera. Why don't we do a fake?" "Yeah, ok, sure, why not? Now, lets come back, think of something nice to say to the public on TV...and then go." (then there's the fact that the cameras were attached to the spacesuit)
 
 Another point to make:
 
 It can easily proved that the pictures are not fake. For instance, all those "discrepancies" of various "mistakes" are not "mistakes" after all. They came out as mistakes because that we took them on the moon, and I'm sure everyone realized a long time ago that common sense as we know it broke down on the moon.
 In other words, the "mistakes" prove that we did go to the moon because that these situations can occur only on the moon - not on earth.
 
 Finally...
 
 
shadows: in a lot of the pictures, the shadows do not match.

 I believe that giligan is arguing that the shadows go of different people go in different directions, and that can't be possible on the moon because there is only one light source, the sun, and of course the sun is the only light source because the idiot who came up with that argument in the first place forgot that the earth, the surface of the moon, the astronauts, and the lunar lander ALL reflected light onto the moon.
 
 Sorry if my arguments seem a little jumbled or out of place...this was my first time reading through this thread and I tried to find some way to respond to various posts.

I have an odd, but compromise theory...
 
 I believe Armstrong et al got to the moon, but they weren't sure about the quality of the pictures, so before-hand they staged them, and then broadcast these.
 
 In other words, the landings were real, but some of the pictures were fake!
 
 emoticon_zzzz

 
 I don't think that we would even consider faking hte images and making them a proper quality, because then people would consider them to be fake. There is no reason to suggest that they didn't use legitimate images and raise public skepticism. We would not fake our way to the moon and lose the trust of both our nation and other nations just to put a flag on a peice of dirt. As for the other discrepancies...have any of YOU ever been to the moon? I didn't think so, so you clearly wouldn't know.
